SENT.plain: There has been accumulating evidence that CD4(+)CD25(+) FoxP3 expressing regulatory T cells (Treg) are highly concentrated in tumors, thereby fostering an immune-privileged microenvironment
Some studies have shown that T-cell receptor (TCR) stimulation can convert conventional T cells into Treg
Follicular lymphoma (FL) B cells can enhance this Treg conversion
We investigated whether FL tumor B cells, as opposed to normal B cells, are unique in their ability to convert effector T cells into Treg
We found that tumor B cells alone, without artificial TCR stimulation, could induce conventional T cells to express FoxP3 and to acquire regulatory function
In contrast to their malignant counterpart, normal B cells did not induce Treg conversion
Treg conversion was independent of the T cell background, as T cells isolated from FL or normal peripheral blood were equally susceptible to being converted by tumor B cells
Our study provides evidence for a tumor-specific mechanism by which FL tumor cells promote immune escape through the induction of Treg
